places.name: Amber Fort, Jaipur
places.description: 16th‑century hilltop fortress of pink sandstone overlooking Maota Lake. Known for its Sheesh Mahal (mirror palace) and courtyards.

places.name: Hawa Mahal, Jaipur
places.description: The 'Palace of Winds' has 953 ornate windows for royal women to view festivals unseen—a honeycomb façade icon.

places.name: City Palace, Udaipur
places.description: A sprawling palace complex on Lake Pichola combining Rajasthani and Mughal architecture, with mosaics and balconies.

places.name: Munnar
places.description: Hill station in the Western Ghats at 1,600 m elevation. Famed for rolling tea plantations and mist‑clad peaks.

places.name: Lockhart Tea Museum
places.description: Set in a 1930s tea factory, showcases colonial equipment and bean‑to‑cup tea‑making history.

places.name: Lakkom Falls
places.description: A multi‑tier waterfall in lush forest near Munnar, perfect for trekking and scenic nature walks.

places.name: Gateway of India, Mumbai
places.description: Iconic basalt arch built in 1924 to welcome British royalty, standing 26 m tall at Mumbai's waterfront.

places.name: Ajanta Caves, Aurangabad
places.description: Rock‑cut Buddhist cave monuments (2nd century BCE–480 CE), famed for expressive murals and sculptures.

places.name: Shaniwar Wada, Pune
places.description: 18th‑century Maratha citadel, once palace‑fortress of the Peshwas. Famous for its ruins and fountains.

places.name: Rishikesh
places.description: Spiritual town on the Ganges, known for Laxman Jhula, yoga ashrams, and river‑rafting.

places.name: Nainital
places.description: Hill station built around a pear‑shaped lake, surrounded by wooded hills—ideal for boating and walks.

places.name: Haridwar
places.description: One of Hinduism’s seven holiest cities where the Ganges descends to plains; Ganga‑aarti at dusk is mesmerizing.

places.name: Meenakshi Temple, Madurai
places.description: Majestic 17th‑century temple complex with towering gopurams covered in colorful sculptures.

places.name: Ooty
places.description: Queen of hill stations, situated in the Nilgiris at 2,240 m. Known for its lake, railway & tea estates.

places.name: Mahabalipuram
places.description: 7th‑century UNESCO site of rock‑cut temples and sculptures by Pallava kings on the Bay of Bengal.

places.name: Darjeeling
places.description: Hill station famed for Darjeeling tea, the UNESCO toy train, and Himalayan sunrise views over Kanchenjunga.

places.name: Sundarbans
places.description: World’s largest mangrove forest, home to Royal Bengal tigers and a unique estuarine ecosystem.

places.name: Victoria Memorial, Kolkata
places.description: White marble palace‑museum built in British era, set in a landscaped garden overlooking the Maidan.

places.name: Calangute Beach
places.description: One of Goa’s busiest beaches with water‑sports, beach shacks and vibrant nightlife.

places.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus, Old Goa
places.description: UNESCO World Heritage church holding St. Francis Xavier’s remains; famed Baroque architecture.

places.name: Dudhsagar Falls
places.description: Tall four‑tiered waterfall on Mandovi River, plunging in foamy white—a must‑see in monsoon.

places.name: Red Fort
places.description: 17th‑century Mughal red sandstone fortress; site of India’s Independence Day speech.

places.name: Qutub Minar
places.description: 72.5‑m tall tapering minaret from 13th century; UNESCO site with ornate inscriptions and iron pillar.

places.name: India Gate
places.description: War memorial arch‑monument in Delhi, built to honor soldiers from WW I and Afghan wars.

places.name: Gangtok
places.description: Capital city nestled in the Himalayas, base for treks & Tibetan Buddhist monasteries.

places.name: Tsomgo Lake
places.description: High‑altitude glacial lake at 3,780 m, sacred to locals and surrounded by snow‑capped peaks.

places.name: Nathula Pass
places.description: Mountain pass on India‑China border via old Silk Route, offering snow vistas and historical memorials.

places.name: Shimla
places.description: Once British summer capital, hill‑station with colonial architecture, Mall Road, and toy train.

places.name: Manali
places.description: Popular hill‑station in Kullu Valley, known for Solang Valley and adventure sports.

places.name: Dharamshala
places.description: Headquarters of the Dalai Lama in exile, scenic town with Tibetan culture and trekking routes.
